children.name: hardware b1
children.definition: hardware/ˈhɑːʳdweəʳ/  computer equipment, rather than the programs that make it work:
examples: ổ cứng
▪ the company has spent millions of dollars replacing outdated computer hardware.
hardwarenoun[ u ]computer phần cứng
the physical and electronic parts of a computer, rather than the instructions it follows

children.name: computer a1
children.definition: computer/kəmˈpjuːtəʳ/  an electronic machine that uses programs to store and deal with large amounts of information quickly, and which is used for a wide range of different jobs:
examples: máy tính
by computer

▪ the information from the survey is being processed by computer.on a computer▪ i can’t get the program to work on my computer.▪ how long are you going to be on the computer? i need to type something.computer literate able to use a computer fairly well▪ it is important that all children become computer literate while they are in school.

children.name: machine x
examples: máy tính
▪ i think there’s something wrong with my machine - would you take a look at it?
machinenoun[ c ]computer
specializeda computer
_you'll need a powerful machine for editing videos.

children.name: mp3 player a2
examples: an electronic device or a computer program for playing music which has been stored as mp3 files

children.name: return b1
examples: [ u ] the key on a computer keyboard that you press in order to say that the words or numbers on the screen are correct, or that an instruction should be performed, or in order to move down a line on the screen
_press return/the return key twice to leave a blank line.

children.name: cursor b2
children.definition: cursornoun con trỏ trên màn hình máy điện toán
examples: amarker(= small sign) usually an arrow or a vertical line, on a computer screen which movesto show the point where work is being done
_you canmovethe cursor either by using the mouse or by using the arrow keys on the keyboard.

children.name: touch screen x
examples: a computer screen that you touch to get information, buy something, etc.
_customers use a touch screen to buy tickets.

children.name: trackball x
children.definition: trackballnoun bi xoay; bi điều khiển; bi lăn
examples: a ball on the keyboard of alaptopor other computer that you roll with your finger in order to move thecursoron the screen

children.name: touchpad x
examples: a special area on alaptopor other computer that you touch in order to move thecursoror give an instruction

children.name: mouse a2
examples: [ c ] a small device which you move across a surface in order to move acursoron your computer screen

children.name: printer a2
examples: a machine that is connected to a computer and prints onto paper using ink
_a bubble-jet/dot-matrix/laser printer

children.name: scanner x
examples: a device for making images of the inside of the body or for readinginformation into a computer system
_an ultrasound scanner
_bar code scanners

children.name: monitor b2
examples: a device with a screen on which words or pictures can be shown
_a computer monitor
_a tv monitor
_doctors watched the old man's heartbeat on a monitor.

children.name: add-on x
examples: a piece of equipment which can be connected to a computer to give it an extra use
_a modem is a useful add-on.

children.name: gamepad x
examples: something that you hold in your hand and use for controlling a computer game orvideo game(= a game in which you make pictures move on a screen)

children.name: tablet x
examples: (alsotablet pc) a small computer with a screen that you can write on using a specialpen or that you can connect a keyboard to

children.name: desktop b2
examples: [ c ] (alsodesktop computer) a type of computer that is small enough to fit on the top of a desk

children.name: personal computer x
children.definition: personal computernoun (abbreviationpc) máy tính cá nhâna medium-sized computer which is used mainly by people at home rather than by large

children.name: laptop a2
children.definition: laptop/ˈlæptɒpǁ-tɑːp/  a small computer that you can carry with you and use when you are travelling:
examples: máy tính xách tay
▪ her boss’s laptop got stolen from her car.
laptop (computer)noun[ c ] máy tính xách tay;
a computer which is small enough to be carried around easily and is designed for use outside an office
_a laptop would be really useful for when i'm working on the train.

children.name: pc a2
children.definition: pc/ˌpiː ˈsiː/  personal computer; a computer that is usually used by one person in an office, at home, or in a school:
examples: máy tính cá nhân
▪ sales of pcs were down for the second year running.
pcnoun[ c ]computer máy tính cá nhân
(alsopc)abbreviation forpersonal computer
_the price of pcs has been tumbling recently.

children.name: workstation x
children.definition: workstation/ˈwɜːʳkˌsteɪʃən/  a computer - used especially by computer manufacturers for the names of particular models of computer:
examples: máy làm việc
▪ i have to share my workstation with two other people in the office.
workstationnoun[ c ]máy tính cónối mạng; trạm làm việc
a keyboard and screen with which a person can use a computer system, or an area in an office, factory, etc. where a single person works

children.name: notebook x
examples: (alsonotebook computer) a very small computer which you can carry easily

children.name: motherboard x
examples: the mainprinted circuit boardthat contains thecpuof a computer and makes it possible for the other parts of a computer to communicate with each other

children.name: cpu
children.definition: noun bộ xử lý trung tâm
examples: abbreviation forcentral processing unit: the part of a computer that controls all the other parts

children.name: drive b1
examples: [ c ] a device for storing computer information
_a floppy/hard drive
_a dvd drive
_a cd drive
hard drivenoun[ c ] (alsohard disk)ổ đĩacứng
a magnetic device that is fixed inside a computer and stores a very large amount of information

children.name: card b1
examples: [ c ] a thin plate inside a computer whichcontains very small electroniccircuitsand which controls certain operations of the computer
_a graphics/sound card
graphics cardnoun[ c ] (alsovideo card)
acircuit board(= small piece of electronic equipment) inside a computer that allows it to receive and show pictures and video
sound cardnoun[ c ]
acircuit board(= small piece of electronic equipment)inside a computer that allows it to record and play sounds
video cardnoun[ c ]
acircuit board(= small piece of electronic equipment) inside a computer that allows it toreceive and show moving images

children.name: processor x
examples: the part of a computer that performs operations on the information that is put into it

children.name: chip b2
children.definition: chipnouncomputer part mạch vi xử lý; vi mạch
examples: [ c ] (alsomicrochip)specializeda very small piece ofsemiconductor, especially in a computer,that contains extremely small electronic circuits and devices, and can perform particular operations
_a silicon chip

children.name: microprocessor x
examples: đơn vị xử lý số liệu trung tâm của máy tính,
a part of a computer that controls its main operations

children.name: client x
examples: a computer that is connected to aserver(= large central computer) from which it gets information

children.name: server b1
children.definition: servernouncomputing hệ phục vụ; máy phục vụ; máy chủ
examples: specializeda central computer fromwhich other computers get information
_a client/network/file server

children.name: terminal x
examples: a piece of equipment consisting of a keyboard and screen, which is used forcommunicating with the part of a computing system that deals with information

children.name: keyboard a2
examples: the set of keyson a computer ortypewriterthat you press in order tomake it work,or the row of keyson a musical instrument such as a piano

children.name: storage device x
examples: a piece of computer equipment in which information and instructions can be kept

children.name: ram
children.definition: noun bộ nhớ truy cập ngẫu nhiên
examples: specialized abbreviation forrandom access memory: a type of computer memory which can be searched in any order and changed as necessary

children.name: cache x
children.definition: cachenoun(alsocache memory)  bộ nhớ truy cập nhanh
examples: an area or type of computermemoryin which information that is often in use can be stored temporarily and got to especially quickly
_256kb secondary cache

children.name: memory a2
examples: [ c usually singular u] the part of a computerin which information or programs are stored either permanently or temporarily, or the amount ofspace available on it for storing information
_my computer has a gigabyte of memory.
virtual memorynoun[ u ]bộ nhớ ảo; bộ lưu giữ ảo
space that can be used on the hard drive of a computer tostore information temporarilyso that there is more ram available when it is needed by software such as a computer game

children.name: rom x
examples: specialized abbreviation forread only memory: a type of computer memory which holds informationthat can be used but not changed or added to

children.name: usb x
examples: universal serial bus: a part of a computer to which extra devices such as printers,scanners and digital cameras can be connected easily without restarting the system
_a usbport
